tasks.task: Identify and describe the diverse agricultural practices and biodiversity observed in a historical Mayan farming system.
subtasks: Notice and mention the presence of various crops such as coconut, coffee, banana, pineapple, Rolinea deliciosa, Cassiograndis (leguminous tree species), erythrina pepnaum, among others.
Estimate the population density of the Mayan settlement based on the number of house mounds and average household size.
Compare the traditional farming methods of local communities (slush and burn, two crop cycle of corn and beans) with the diversified farming system presented by the speaker.
Discuss the environmental impact of slush and burn agriculture and its alternatives.
Highlight the role of leguminous trees in soil nitrogen fixation and other benefits.
Explain the concept of sustainable farming practices observed in the Mayan system, such as integrating chickens for pest control and manure production.
Reflect on the value of traditional farming knowledge and the importance of conservation and stewardship of land.
